Submodules

main.admin module

class main.admin.FigureAdmin(model, admin_site)

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin interface for managing Figure objects in the Django admin panel.

This class customizes the display and search functionality for Figure models in the admin interface. Figures will be displayed in a list with their name and description, and the search bar allows for filtering based on the name field.

list_display = ('name', 'description')

Fields to display in the list view of the Figure model in the admin panel.

Type:

tuple

Value:

(‘name’, ‘description’)

Displays the ‘name’ and ‘description’ of each Figure instance.

property media
search_fields = ('name',)

Fields that will be used in the search bar in the admin panel.

Type:

tuple

Value:

(‘name’,)

Allows admins to search Figure instances by their ‘name’.

main.apps module

class main.apps.MainConfig(app_name, app_module)

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration class for the ‘main’ application in the Django project.

This class defines the configuration settings for the ‘main’ app, such as the default primary key field type and the name of the app.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'

Specifies the type of auto-created primary key field to use by default for models in this app.

Type:

str

name = 'main'

The name of the Django application.

Type:

str

main.forms module

class main.forms.UserRegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelForm

Custom user registration form that extends Django’s ModelForm.

This form is used to register new users, with additional fields for password confirmation and an optional checkbox for receiving emails about development updates and game news.

class Meta

Bases: object

Meta class that defines the model and fields for the form.

fields = ['username', 'email', 'password', 'password2']

username, email, password, and password confirmation. :type: list[str]

Type:

Fields to be included in the form

model

alias of User

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'receive_emails': <django.forms.fields.BooleanField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
clean()

Custom validation method to check if the two password fields match.

Returns:

Cleaned form data if validation succeeds.

Raises:

forms.ValidationError – If the passwords do not match.

declared_fields = {'password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'receive_emails': <django.forms.fields.BooleanField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

password

Field for the user’s password input. The ‘PasswordInput’ widget ensures that the password is masked when entered.

Type:

str

password2

Field for confirming the password input by the user. Also uses the ‘PasswordInput’ widget for masking the input.

Type:

str

receive_emails

Optional checkbox for users to indicate whether they’d like to receive emails about updates and news related to the project. Defaults to unchecked.

Type:

bool

main.models module

class main.models.Figure(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Model representing a figure entity.

This model stores information about figures, including their name and description. It can be used for managing data related to figures in the application.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

description

A detailed description of the figure.

Type:

str

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name

Name of the figure.

Type:

str

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

main.views module

main.views.about(request)

View function for the about page.

Renders the ‘about.html’ template to provide information about the website or application.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘about.html’ template.

main.views.contact(request)

View function for the contact page with a user registration form.

Handles the POST request to register a new user. If the form is valid, the user is authenticated and logged in, then redirected to the success page. For GET requests, it displays an empty registration form.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘contact.html’ template with the registration form, or redirect to the ‘success’ page upon successful registration.

main.views.figures_view(request)

View function to display a list of all figures.

Fetches all the figures from the database and passes them to the ‘figures.html’ template for rendering.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘figures.html’ template, populated with all figures.

main.views.home(request)

View function for the home page.

Renders the ‘home.html’ template when users access the home page.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘home.html’ template.

main.views.success(request)

View function for the success page.

Renders the ‘success.html’ template after successful user registration or other operations that warrant a success confirmation.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘success.html’ template.
